name: Roadside Assistance Simulator
description: Experience the everyday duties of a roadside assistance team in this realistic mix of simulation and management game. Direct your rescue team from your roadside assistance center. Unlock new regions and try to attract as many new customers as possible through successful and efficient operations.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista/7/8 Processor: Athlon®/Pentium IV® or comparable 2 GHz processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 256 MB 3D graphics card - ATI RADEON X1800/NVIDIA GEFORCE 8000/INTEL HD 3000 OR HIGHER DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 700 MB available space Sound Card: Sound card Additional Notes: keyboard, mouse with scroll wheel

reviews.review_text: So I read through the reviews before I bought this game with a bit of trepidation - usually, lots of bad reviews are a bad sign. But, this was £2.50, so I though 'why not?' took the plunge and went for it. 90 minutes in, I'm greatful I did.   In terms of gameplay, it is limited, I'd admit. There are 3 modes, where you manage your fleet and staff's abilities, a mode where you dispatch units to regions that increase in size, and a mission mode, where you need to investigate and fix faults with customers cars (a bit like car mechanic sim).  Overall, while gameplay is limited, this is a good little game, so if it comes up at a bargin price, get it, even if it just lasts a few hours, the relaxation and addictiveness is worth it for the time. I'm around half way through, and not sure of the replay value, but I'm grateful I went for it after all!
A little chalenging but I love a chalenge
